trans-unit.source: Using tags to organize your Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Using tags to organize your Azure resources

trans-unit.source: Shows how to apply tags to organize resources for billing and managing.
trans-unit.target: Shows how to apply tags to organize resources for billing and managing.

trans-unit.source: Using tags to organize your Azure resources
trans-unit.target: Using tags to organize your Azure resources

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal and the underlying Resource Manager are about organizing your resources and customizing your experience to be tailor-fit just for you.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal and the underlying Resource Manager are about organizing your resources and customizing your experience to be tailor-fit just for you.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure classic portal, subscriptions are the only way to categorize and group your resources.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure classic portal, subscriptions are the only way to categorize and group your resources.

trans-unit.source: With the Azure portal, <link><linkText>we introduced resource groups</linkText><title></title></link>, which enable you to group related entities.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure portal, <link><linkText>we introduced resource groups</linkText><title></title></link>, which enable you to group related entities.

trans-unit.source: This became even more valuable when <link><linkText>we introduced role-based access</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This became even more valuable when <link><linkText>we introduced role-based access</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Now, in that same spirit, you can tag your resources with key/value pairs to further categorize and view resources across resource groups and, within the portal, across subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Now, in that same spirit, you can tag your resources with key/value pairs to further categorize and view resources across resource groups and, within the portal, across subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Group resources by team, project, or even environment to focus on exactly what you want to see, when you need to see it.
trans-unit.target: Group resources by team, project, or even environment to focus on exactly what you want to see, when you need to see it.

trans-unit.source: Tags in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Tags in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Tagging resources and resource groups in the portal is easy.
trans-unit.target: Tagging resources and resource groups in the portal is easy.

trans-unit.source: Use the Browse hub to navigate to the resource or resource group you’d like to tag and click the Tags part in the Overview section at the top of the blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the Browse hub to navigate to the resource or resource group you’d like to tag and click the Tags part in the Overview section at the top of the blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>资源和资源组叶片的标签部分</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>资源和资源组叶片的标签部分</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This will open a blade with the list of tags that have already been applied.
trans-unit.target: This will open a blade with the list of tags that have already been applied.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first tag, the list will be empty.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first tag, the list will be empty.

trans-unit.source: To add a tag, simply specify a name and value and press Enter.
trans-unit.target: To add a tag, simply specify a name and value and press Enter.

trans-unit.source: After you've added a few tags, you'll notice autocomplete options based on pre-existing tag names and values to better ensure a consistent taxonomy across your resources and to avoid common mistakes, like misspellings.
trans-unit.target: After you've added a few tags, you'll notice autocomplete options based on pre-existing tag names and values to better ensure a consistent taxonomy across your resources and to avoid common mistakes, like misspellings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Tag resources with name/value pairs</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Tag resources with name/value pairs</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From here, you can click on each individual tag to view a list of all the resources with the same tag.
trans-unit.target: From here, you can click on each individual tag to view a list of all the resources with the same tag.

trans-unit.source: Of course, if this is your first tag, that list won't be very interesting.
trans-unit.target: Of course, if this is your first tag, that list won't be very interesting.

trans-unit.source: For now, let's jump over to PowerShell to tag all of our resources quickly.
trans-unit.target: For now, let's jump over to PowerShell to tag all of our resources quickly.

trans-unit.source: Tagging with PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Tagging with PowerShell

trans-unit.source: First thing's first, grab the latest <link><linkText>Azure PowerShell module</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: First thing's first, grab the latest <link><linkText>Azure PowerShell module</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first time using the Azure PowerShell module, <link><linkText>read the documentation</linkText><title></title></link> to get up to speed.
trans-unit.target: If this is your first time using the Azure PowerShell module, <link><linkText>read the documentation</linkText><title></title></link> to get up to speed.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this article, we'll assume you've already added an account and selected a subscription with the resources you want to tag.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this article, we'll assume you've already added an account and selected a subscription with the resources you want to tag.

trans-unit.source: Tagging is only available for resources and resource groups available from <link><linkText>Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>, so the next thing we need to do is switch to use Resource Manager.
trans-unit.target: Tagging is only available for resources and resource groups available from <link><linkText>Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>, so the next thing we need to do is switch to use Resource Manager.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>使用 Azure PowerShell 与蔚蓝的资源管理器</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>使用 Azure PowerShell 与蔚蓝的资源管理器</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Tags exist directly on resources and resource groups, so to see what tags are already applied, we can simply get a resource or resource group with Get-AzureResource 或 Get-AzureResourceGroup, respectively.
trans-unit.target: Tags exist directly on resources and resource groups, so to see what tags are already applied, we can simply get a resource or resource group with Get-AzureResource 或 Get-AzureResourceGroup, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Let's start with a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Let's start with a resource group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Getting tags with Get-AzureResourceGroup in PowerShell</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Getting tags with Get-AzureResourceGroup in PowerShell</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet returns several bits of metadata on the resource group including what tags have been applied, if any.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet returns several bits of metadata on the resource group including what tags have been applied, if any.

trans-unit.source: To tag a resource group, we'll simply use Set-AzureResourceGroup and specify a tag name and value.
trans-unit.target: To tag a resource group, we'll simply use Set-AzureResourceGroup and specify a tag name and value.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setting tags with Set-AzureResourceGroup in PowerShell</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setting tags with Set-AzureResourceGroup in PowerShell</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Remember that tags are updated as a whole, so if you are adding one tag to a resource that's already been tagged, you'll need to use an array with all the tags you want to keep.
trans-unit.target: Remember that tags are updated as a whole, so if you are adding one tag to a resource that's already been tagged, you'll need to use an array with all the tags you want to keep.

trans-unit.source: To remove one, simply save the array without the one you want to remove.
trans-unit.target: To remove one, simply save the array without the one you want to remove.

trans-unit.source: The process is the same for resources, except you'll use the Get-AzureResource 和 Set-AzureResource cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: The process is the same for resources, except you'll use the Get-AzureResource 和 Set-AzureResource cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: To get resources or resource groups with a specific tag, use Get-AzureResource 或 Get-AzureResourceGroup cmdlet with the -Tag parameter.
trans-unit.target: To get resources or resource groups with a specific tag, use Get-AzureResource 或 Get-AzureResourceGroup cmdlet with the -Tag parameter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Getting tagged resources and resource groups with Get-AzureResource and Get-AzureResourceGroup in PowerShell</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Getting tagged resources and resource groups with Get-AzureResource and Get-AzureResourceGroup in PowerShell</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Tagging with Resource Manager
trans-unit.target: Tagging with Resource Manager

trans-unit.source: The portal and PowerShell both use the <link><linkText>Resource Manager REST API</linkText><title></title></link> behind the scenes.
trans-unit.target: The portal and PowerShell both use the <link><linkText>Resource Manager REST API</linkText><title></title></link> behind the scenes.

trans-unit.source: If you need to integrate tagging into another environment, you can get tags with a GET on the resource id and update the set of tags with a PATCH call.
trans-unit.target: If you need to integrate tagging into another environment, you can get tags with a GET on the resource id and update the set of tags with a PATCH call.

trans-unit.source: Managing your taxonomy
trans-unit.target: Managing your taxonomy

trans-unit.source: Earlier, we talked about how autocomplete helps you ensure consistency and avoid mistakes.
trans-unit.target: Earlier, we talked about how autocomplete helps you ensure consistency and avoid mistakes.

trans-unit.source: Autocomplete is populated based on the taxonomy of available tags setup for the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Autocomplete is populated based on the taxonomy of available tags setup for the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Each tag you add to a resource or resource group is automatically added to the subscription-wide taxonomy, but you can also prepopulate that taxonomy with tag names and values you'd like to use as resources are tagged in the future.
trans-unit.target: Each tag you add to a resource or resource group is automatically added to the subscription-wide taxonomy, but you can also prepopulate that taxonomy with tag names and values you'd like to use as resources are tagged in the future.

trans-unit.source: To get a list of all tags within a subscription using PowerShell, use the Get-AzureTag cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To get a list of all tags within a subscription using PowerShell, use the Get-AzureTag cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get-AzureTag in PowerShell</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get-AzureTag in PowerShell</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may see tags that start with "hidden-" and "link:".
trans-unit.target: You may see tags that start with "hidden-" and "link:".

trans-unit.source: These are internal tags, which you should ignore and avoid changing.
trans-unit.target: These are internal tags, which you should ignore and avoid changing.

trans-unit.source: 使用 New-AzureTag cmdlet to add new tags to the taxonomy.
trans-unit.target: 使用 New-AzureTag cmdlet to add new tags to the taxonomy.

trans-unit.source: These tags will be included in the autocomplete even though they haven't been applied to any resources or resource groups, yet.
trans-unit.target: These tags will be included in the autocomplete even though they haven't been applied to any resources or resource groups, yet.

trans-unit.source: To remove a tag name/value, first remove the tag from any resources it may be used with and then use the Remove-AzureTag cmdlet to remove it from the taxonomy.
trans-unit.target: To remove a tag name/value, first remove the tag from any resources it may be used with and then use the Remove-AzureTag cmdlet to remove it from the taxonomy.

trans-unit.source: To view your taxonomy of tags in the portal, use the Browse hub to view Everything and then select Tags.
trans-unit.target: To view your taxonomy of tags in the portal, use the Browse hub to view Everything and then select Tags.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Find tags via the Browse hub</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Find tags via the Browse hub</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Pin the most important tags to your Startboard for quick access and you're ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Pin the most important tags to your Startboard for quick access and you're ready to go.

trans-unit.source: Have fun!
trans-unit.target: Have fun!

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Pin tags to the Startboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Pin tags to the Startboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Tagging and billing
trans-unit.target: Tagging and billing

trans-unit.source: For supported services, you can use tags to group your billing data.
trans-unit.target: For supported services, you can use tags to group your billing data.

trans-unit.source: For example, <link><linkText>Virtual Machines integrated with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> enable
trans-unit.target: For example, <link><linkText>Virtual Machines integrated with Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link> enable

trans-unit.source: you to define and apply tags to organize the billing usage for virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: you to define and apply tags to organize the billing usage for virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If you are running multiple VMs for different organizations, you can use the tags to group usage by cost center.
trans-unit.target: If you are running multiple VMs for different organizations, you can use the tags to group usage by cost center.

trans-unit.source: You can also use tags to categorize costs by runtime environment; such as, the billing usage for VMs running in production environment.
trans-unit.target: You can also use tags to categorize costs by runtime environment; such as, the billing usage for VMs running in production environment.

trans-unit.source: You can retrieve information about tags through the <link><linkText>usage api</linkText><title></title></link> or the usage comma-separated values (CSV) file that you can download from
trans-unit.target: You can retrieve information about tags through the <link><linkText>usage api</linkText><title></title></link> or the usage comma-separated values (CSV) file that you can download from

trans-unit.source: the <link><linkText>Azure accounts portal</linkText><title></title></link> 或 <link><linkText>EA portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: the <link><linkText>Azure accounts portal</linkText><title></title></link> 或 <link><linkText>EA portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you download the usage CSV for services that support tags with billing, the tags will appear in the Tags column.
trans-unit.target: When you download the usage CSV for services that support tags with billing, the tags will appear in the Tags column.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>Understand your bill for Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>Understand your bill for Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>See tags in billing</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>See tags in billing</linkText>
